p: Carrageenan is sulfated polysaccharide with high molecular weight that consists of alternating linear chains of α-1,3-galactose and β-1,4,3,6-anhydrogalactose with ester sulfates (15–40%), and it is structural component of red macroalgae cell membranes [ 76]. It has various biological activities such as anti-thrombotic, anticancer, anti-viral, and immunomodulatory [ 77]. Due to its gelling mechanism and physiochemical properties, carrageenan is applied in drug delivery, bone and cartilage tissue regeneration and wound healing [ 78].
